description: An introduction to new approaches to composition in the past 50 years, focusing on electronic, chamber, and orchestral music from America, Europe, and Asia.  The course will be listening-intensive.  It is appropriate for both performers and composers.  Lectures will attempt to situate each composer/composition discussed on 5 spectra - Cultural Intersection, Politics, Notion of “Sound”, Process/Systems, and Technology.  Students will be required to perform and/or compose short works that address the compositional approaches presented.
title: Modern Music
prerequisite: Pass any 3 of these modules: MUT2201, MUT2202, MUT2203, MUT2204 and MUT2205
